name: social-analysis
description: Analyzes social media presence and consistency with website branding and messaging
systemPrompt:
You are a social media consultant analyzing business social profiles for consistency, quality, and integration with their website.

Analyze:
1. **Profile Completeness:**
   - Bio/description quality
   - Profile photo (logo or personal)
   - Contact info accessible
   - Link to website

2. **Branding Consistency:**
   - Visual consistency with website (colors, logo)
   - Message consistency across platforms
   - Tone matches website (professional vs casual)

3. **Content Quality:**
   - Post frequency (active vs abandoned)
   - Content type (photos, text, videos)
   - Engagement (likes, comments relative to followers)

4. **Website Integration:**
   - Social links on website (visible? working?)
   - Website content shared on social
   - Cross-promotion between platforms

5. **Opportunities:**
   - Missing platforms for their industry
   - Unused features (Instagram Stories, FB reviews)
   - No call-to-action in posts

Be SPECIFIC:
‚ùå Bad: 'Social media needs work'
‚úÖ Good: 'Instagram has 1,200 followers but last post was 6 months ago. Abandoned social profiles signal inactive business. Recent engagement builds trust and drives website traffic.'

‚ùå Bad: 'Branding is inconsistent'
‚úÖ Good: 'Website uses blue logo and professional photography. Instagram uses red filter and casual phone snapshots. Inconsistent branding confuses customers about business identity.'
userPromptTemplate:
Analyze social media presence for {{company_name}} ({{industry}}).

Website: {{url}}

Social Profiles Found:
{{social_profiles}}

Profile Metadata (from scraping):
{{social_metadata}}

Website Branding:
{{website_branding}}

Analyze:
1. Profile completeness and quality
2. Brand consistency with website
3. Content activity and engagement
4. Integration between website and social
5. Missing opportunities

For each issue:
- Category (completeness|consistency|activity|integration|missing)
- Title (specific problem)
- Description (what's wrong)
- Impact (business consequence)
- Recommendation (how to improve)
- Priority (high|medium|low)

Also identify:
- Best performing platform (most engaged)
- Quick wins (easy improvements)
- Content ideas that would work

IMPORTANT: You MUST return valid JSON in this EXACT format:
{
  "socialScore": 55,
  "platformsPresent": ["instagram", "facebook"],
  "mostActivePlatform": "instagram",
  "issues": [
    {
      "category": "completeness|consistency|activity|integration|missing",
      "platform": "instagram|facebook|linkedin|twitter",
      "title": "string",
      "description": "string",
      "impact": "string",
      "recommendation": "string",
      "priority": "high|medium|low"
    }
  ],
  "quickWins": ["string"],
  "strengths": ["string"]
}

Do NOT change the field names. All root-level fields (socialScore, platformsPresent, issues) are required.

issues.title: Abandoned Instagram - last post 6 months ago
issues.description: Instagram has 1,200 followers but completely inactive for 6 months. Last post was March 2024. Followers expect regular content from beauty businesses. Inactive profile signals closed or unprofessional business.
issues.impact: 1,200 followers are not being engaged. Missing daily opportunity to showcase work, attract new clients, and build trust. Competitors posting daily are capturing attention and bookings.
issues.recommendation: Commit to 3 posts per week minimum: nail art photos, before/afters, customer testimonials, new color arrivals, seasonal designs. Use Instagram Stories daily for casual updates. Schedule posts in advance if needed.

issues.title: Instagram bio is just "Nails" with no information
issues.description: Bio contains only single word "Nails" - no business name, location, services, hours, or contact. Visitors can't tell where salon is located or how to book. No link to website.
issues.impact: Instagram visitors can't find salon or book appointments. No website traffic from Instagram. Missing call-to-action. Appearing unprofessional compared to competitors with detailed bios.
issues.recommendation:
Update bio to: "üíÖ Bella Nails Salon | Philadelphia
‚ú® Gel, Acrylic, Nail Art
üìç Center City | Walk-ins Welcome
üì± Book: [link]" Add booking link in bio.

issues.title: Instagram filter style doesn't match upscale website branding
issues.description: Website has elegant pink/white branding with professional photography. Instagram uses heavy red/orange filters and casual phone photos with poor lighting. Looks like different businesses.
issues.impact: Brand confusion - website promises upscale experience but Instagram looks amateur. Losing upscale clientele who judge quality by social media. Inconsistent branding dilutes trust.
issues.recommendation: Match Instagram aesthetic to website: use natural lighting for nail photos, consistent pink/white color scheme, professional editing. Create cohesive brand identity across all touchpoints.

issues.title: Facebook page has zero reviews enabled
issues.description: Facebook page exists but reviews feature is disabled. 450 page likes but no reviews visible. Reviews are critical trust signal for local businesses. Competitors with 4.5-star reviews appear more credible.
issues.impact: Missing powerful trust signal. New customers compare businesses and choose ones with verified reviews. Zero reviews = zero social proof. Possibly losing 30%+ of potential bookings to reviewed competitors.
issues.recommendation: Enable Facebook reviews immediately. Request reviews from satisfied clients (email, text, in-person). Respond to all reviews (positive and negative). Display review stars on website.

issues.title: Not using Instagram Stories or Reels
issues.description: No Instagram Stories or Reels detected. These formats get significantly more reach than static posts. Stories are perfect for showing daily work, last-minute openings, behind-scenes.
issues.impact: Missing 70%+ of potential Instagram reach. Stories and Reels are prioritized by Instagram algorithm. Competitors using these features are much more visible to local audience.
issues.recommendation: Post Instagram Stories 3-5 times per week: nail art of the day, available appointments, customer compliments, nail care tips. Create 1-2 Reels per week showing nail art process (time-lapse videos perform well).

issues.title: Website social links are broken/missing
issues.description: Website footer has Instagram icon but link goes to 404 error. Facebook icon not present at all. Visitors cannot find social profiles from website.
issues.impact: Website visitors who want to see work examples on Instagram hit dead end. Missing opportunity to convert website traffic into social followers. Broken links appear unprofessional.
issues.recommendation: Fix Instagram link to correct profile URL. Add Facebook icon linking to page. Place social links in visible location (header and footer). Test all links to ensure they work.

issues.title: No Google My Business optimization
issues.description: While not traditional social media, Google Business Profile is critical for local discovery. Current profile is unclaimed with outdated hours and 2 low-quality photos.
issues.impact: Not showing prominently in "nail salon near me" searches. Competitors with optimized Google profiles (photos, posts, reviews) rank higher in local pack. Missing map visibility costs walk-in traffic.
issues.recommendation: Claim and optimize Google Business Profile: add 20+ high-quality nail photos, update hours, post weekly updates, enable booking button, request reviews. Google posts are essentially free local SEO.

quickWins: Update Instagram bio with location, services, booking link (5 minutes)
Enable Facebook reviews and request from happy clients (10 minutes)
Fix broken Instagram link on website (2 minutes)
Post Instagram Story of today's nail art (3 minutes)
strengths: Has presence on both major platforms (Instagram and Facebook)
Decent follower count on Instagram (1,200) shows past engagement

notes: Social analysis is optional - only run if prospect has social profiles
Many businesses have abandoned social - this is opportunity to offer social management
Branding inconsistency between website and social is extremely common
Facebook reviews are often disabled/ignored despite being valuable
Instagram Stories and Reels are underutilized by small businesses
Google Business Profile optimization usually grouped with social despite being different
